posts.author: Orion
posts.content:
The Infused Ranger

Re-did the build draft after suggestions.
With Bard at level 33 this build can be elf or dwarf, 20% exp penalties from level 33 - 40.
Or human for a bonus feat (Luck of Heroes / Great Fortitude)
Dwarf or human are probably the strongest, but elf is awesome with the keen senses, detection bonuses, dual sword look and extra dex to help with wearing light armor.
I put skill schedules for rangers getting 6 skill points / level (ie WoG), but if you plan to play it where rangers get the standard 4 / lvl, suggest going human subtract 33 (+43 - 76) skill points and drop Taunt, put spot to 43. Dev crit was done in previous drafts but I decided to drop it. 

AB 46 (-2 when dual wielding) with scimitar.
AB is 43 with other weapons. Add 2 AB against favored enemies.

posts.author: webshaman1
posts.content:
First of all, since I really like Rangers, I like this way of thinking, and it looks interesting.  Certainly combining Ranger and RDD is interesting.  There is even a bit of synergy with the Cha boost and Animal Empathy (if one goes all 10 levels of RDD) and some extra Int for more skill points (always useful for a Ranger build, that has so many skill areas that can be covered - I like to call Rangers skill point starved).

Perhaps for the Dev Crit version, take RDD to 10 levels.  That would probably help mightily with the reqs for Dev Crit.

I understand the need for lots of Ranger levels for FEs, but I do strongly feel that one can get more out of having two Bard levels - one to get some UMD, Tumble and RDD earlier, and the last level around 37 or so to top off Tumble and and last dabs to UMD, etc.

I know, it's like "I just need some more levels here!  We need more than 40 darnit!"  I really think that Bioware missed a clever synergy with Harper Scout not being able to combine the FEs with the Ranger stuff.  Just thinking of the possibilities...*sigh*

Anyway, I really like this idea.  Ranger I think is really a "lost class" so often...so much potential and promise, crippled with design decisions.

posts.author: Grimnir
posts.content:
Why aren't you showing off your damage?
Main hand unbuffed:
1d8+12STR+10+2D6FEs for a decent totalt of: 25-42. That's unbuffed with a normal blade. Add 6 more from Strength and 5 from a magic weapon you're at 36-53. Off- hand is lower by 9, but that's sweeeet damage. I have played High level ranger Weapon Masters and it's fun. Defenses are crap, but offensively you carve through anything in no-time.
